717851f-b.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Ridge Street
717851f-b.text:
Broome Street, north side at Ridge Street, showing mainly
the Seventh Presbyterian Church at the N.E. corner. On the
oposite corner (N.W.) is Public School 92.
Two of the views show portions of the latter feature and
ars in a westward direction. Wiew No. 3 is eastward and elininates
the school.

722692f-a.title: Manhattan: Ridge Street - Broome Street
722692f-a.text:
Ridge Street,West side and the south west corner of
Broome Street,looking southwards and across Grand St.
The Synagogue is located on the east side of Ridge
Street at 426.
P.L.Sperr,  May 7th,1939
No reproductions.

717853f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Ridge Street
717853f-a.text:
(1)
144-134 Broome Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of
Ridge Street. The view also shows 44-52 Ridge Street, east side, from
Broome to but not including the south side of Delancey Street, which
is the starting point of the East River Bridge. The building in the
foreground is the Seventh Presbyterian Church.
June 12, 1931. S 1
